      length - the length of string or list
      Returns:
      true if character is out of bounds. false otherwise

      This method checks if the character is a integer by looking at its ASCII code
      Parameters:
      input - the string input provided
      index - the index of the character in the string
      Returns:
      true if a character is an integer. false otherwise

      Returns:

      Returns:

    • checkIfNumCont

      public boolean checkIfNumCont(String input, int index)
      This method checks if a number is continued throughout the string (eq. has more than one digit or is a decimal)
      Parameters:
      input - the string input provided
      index - the index of the character - usually the index after a number has been discovered
      Returns:
      true if the number continues throughout the string, false otherwise

    • newtonRoot

      public double newtonRoot(int root, double base, double value)
      This method finds the root of a number using the Newton method.
      Parameters:
      root - the root to which we apply
      base - the base value
      value - our approximation for every recursion, initial value is equal to 1
      Returns:
      the approximated value once the margin of error between our new estimate and our old estimate falls below 0.00001

    • roundNum

      public double roundNum(double num, int scale)
      This method rounds a number to a specificed decimal place
      Parameters:
      num - the number that needs to be rounded
      scale - the decimal point to round the number to
      Returns:
      the rounded number

    • fraction

      public double[] fraction(double[] frac)
      This method turns a decimal into an integer fraction by multiplying the number with ten until its whole
      Parameters:
      frac - an array usually of size 2 in which the first value is the numerator (the decimal) and the second value is the denominator (initially 1)
      Returns:
      the frac array multiplied by 10 as many times as was needed

    • multiplySelf

      public double multiplySelf(double num, int exponent)
      This method multiplies the base with itself as many times as the exponent specifies. It uses an efficient algorithm to remove any deep recursion.
      Parameters:
      num - the number than needs to be multiplied by itself
      exponent - an integer which tells the method how many times the base needs to be multiplied
      Returns:
      the result of the base multiplied by itself x times (where x = exponent)

    • power

      public double power(double exponent, double base)
      This is a power function that finds fractional exponents by finding the root (root = denominator) of a base, and then raising that result to a integer exponent (exponent = numerator);
      Parameters:
      exponent - The exponent provided that can be fractional or whole
      base - the base number
      Returns:
      the result of the base number raised to the power of the exponent in the argument

    • sortNum

      public int sortNum(ArrayList<Double> numbers, int index, String num, String input)
      This method sorts numbers in a string that by adding them on a string and then parsing that string into a number. The method recurses if the number has more than one digit
      Parameters:
      numbers - the ArrayList of all the numbers in the string
      index - the index of the character currently under evaluation
      num - the string value of the number before it is parsed
      input - the input string analysed
      Returns:
      the index of the last digit of the number

    • checkPriority

      public boolean checkPriority(char operOne, char operTwo)
      This method checks the priority of between two operations
      Parameters:
      operOne - the operator that occurs before
      operTwo - the operator that occurs after
      Returns:
      true if second operator should overtake the first one. false if not

    • removeWhiteSpace

      public String removeWhiteSpace(String input)
      This method removes whitespace from a string
      Parameters:
      input - the string input provided
      Returns:
      a clean string with no white space

    • checkNegativeNumber

      public boolean checkNegativeNumber(int index, String input)
      This method checks if a number is negative by checking if there is a minus character that occurs first in a string, or after an operator
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the character
      input - the string input provided
      Returns:
      true if minus character occurs after an operator or is first in a string. false otherwise

    • sortOperations

      public void sortOperations(ArrayList<Character> symbols, ArrayList<Integer> order, int index)
      This method checks if the last operator added needs to occur before other operators. It recurses through all previous operators until a position is found
      Parameters:
      symbols - the current list of operators found
      order - an ordered list that contains lists when an operator should occur by storing its index
      index - an index value to compare one operator in the ordered list with the new operator

    • readBrackets

      public String readBrackets(String input, int index)
      This method reads the brackets in a string. It finds the index of the last occurring right parentheses and checks the index before it to see if it should use the index of the earliest occurring right parentheses
      Parameters:
      input - The string input provided
      index - the index of the left parentheses
      Returns:
      a substring of input which spans from the left to right parentheses

    • sortString

      public void sortString(String input, ArrayList<Character> symbols, ArrayList<Double> numbers, ArrayList<Integer> order, int index)
      This method sorts a string inputed, by creating a list of the numbers, operators, and the order of operators to follow
      Parameters:
      input - the string input provided
      symbols - a list that contains the operators with each new operator found being added at the end
      numbers - a list that contains the numbers with each new number found being added at the end
      order - a list that contains the order of the operators by storing indices
      index - the current index the method is on in regard to the string argument "input"

    • evaluate

      public double evaluate(double numOne, double numTwo, char operation)
      This method evaluates which arithmetic operation needs to be carried out between two numbers
      Parameters:
      numOne - the first number to use
      numTwo - the second number to use
      operation - the operator
      Returns:
      the result of the two numbers when an operation is performed

    • fixOrder

      public void fixOrder(ArrayList<Integer> order, int index, int value)
      This method fixes indices in the order list, by decrementing the value of indices when the last index used is a smaller index compared to the others stored
      Parameters:
      order - the order list that contains operator indices
      index - the index of the list order that is currently being analysed
      value - the value of the index of the last operator used

    • evaluate

      public double evaluate(ArrayList<Double> numbers, ArrayList<Character> symbols, ArrayList<Integer> order)
      This method evaluates the all numbers and operations by following the order list
      Parameters:
      numbers - the list of numbers found
      symbols - the list of operators found
      order - the list that shows the order of the operators
      Returns:
      the result of all operations

    • evaluate

      public double evaluate(String input)
      the main overloaded evaluate method from the ICalculator interface. Takes in a string, removes all white spaces, then sorts out all numbers and operations and evaluates them all
      Parameters:
      input - the string input provided
      Returns:
      the result of the string
